channel.title: IT-Security & Privacy News Aggregator
channel.description: Aggregierter RSS-Feed aus führenden IT-Security, Privacy und Cyber Policy Quellen

item.title: Experts Warn of Widespread SonicWall VPN Compromise Impacting Over 100 Accounts
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Hackers Turn Velociraptor DFIR Tool Into Weapon in LockBit Ransomware Attacks
item.description: Threat actors are abusing Velociraptor, an open-source digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) tool, in connection with ransomware attacks likely orchestrated by Storm-2603 (aka CL-CRI-1040 or Gold Salem), which is known for deploying the Warlock and LockBit ransomware. The threat actor's use of the security utility was documented by Sophos last month. It's assessed that the attackers
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: 1Password Addresses Critical AI Browser Agent Security Gap
item.description: The security company looks to tackle new authentication challenges that could lead to credential leakage, as enterprises increasingly leverage AI browser agents.
item.dc:creator: Arielle Waldman

item.title: Friday Squid Blogging: Sperm Whale Eating a Giant Squid
item.dc:creator: Bruce Schneier

item.title: RondoDox Botnet: an 'Exploit Shotgun' for Edge Vulns
item.description: RondoDox takes a hit-and-run, shotgun approach to exploiting bugs in consumer edge devices around the world.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: The Fight Against Ransomware Heats Up on the Factory Floor
item.description: Ransomware gangs continue to set their sights on the manufacturing industry, but companies are taking steps to protect themselves, starting with implementing timely patch management protocols.
item.dc:creator: Arielle Waldman

item.title: Feds Shutter ShinyHunters Salesforce Extortion Site
item.description: The group warned that law-enforcement crackdowns are imminent in the wake of the takedown, but its extortion threats against Salesforce victims remain active.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Beek

item.title: DDoS Botnet Aisuru Blankets US ISPs in Record DDoS
item.description: The world's largest and most disruptive botnet is now drawing a majority of its firepower from compromised Internet-of-Things (IoT) devices hosted on U.S. Internet providers like AT&#038;T, Comcast and Verizon, new evidence suggests. Experts say the heavy concentration of infected devices at U.S. providers is complicating efforts to limit collateral damage from the botnet's attacks, which shattered previous records this week with a brief traffic flood that clocked in at nearly 30 trillion bits of data per second.
item.dc:creator: BrianKrebs

item.title: Chinese Hackers Use Velociraptor IR Tool in Ransomware Attacks
item.description: In a new wrinkle for adversary tactics, the Storm-2603 threat group is abusing the digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) tool to gain persistent access to victim networks.
item.dc:creator: Rob Wright

item.title: Microsoft Adds Agentic AI Capabilities to Sentinel
item.description: Microsoft previewed the Sentinel security graph and MCP server at its annual Microsoft Secure virtual event earlier this month.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Schwartz

item.title: 77% of Employees Share Company Secrets on ChatGPT, Report Warns
item.description: <p>New report reveals 77% of employees share sensitive company data through ChatGPT and AI tools, creating major security and compliance risks.</p> <p>The post <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com/article/news-employees-share-company-secrets-on-chatgpt/">77% of Employees Share Company Secrets on ChatGPT, Report Warns</a> appeared first on <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com">TechRepublic</a>.</p>
item.dc:creator: Ken Underhill

item.title: Deepfake Awareness High at Orgs, But Cyber Defenses Badly Lag
item.description: The vast majority of organizations are encountering AI-augmented threats, but remain confident in their defenses, despite inadequate detection investment and more than half falling to successful attacks.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Stealit Malware Abuses Node.js Single Executable Feature via Game and VPN Installers
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of an active malware campaign called Stealit that has leveraged Node.js' Single Executable Application (SEA) feature as a way to distribute its payloads. According to Fortinet FortiGuard Labs, select iterations have also employed the open-source Electron framework to deliver the malware. It's assessed that the malware is being propagated through
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Commentary Section Launches New, More Opinionated Era
item.description: Dark Reading is looking for leading industry experts with a point of view they want to share with the rest of the cybersecurity community for our new Commentary section.
item.dc:creator: Becky Bracken

item.title: Microsoft Warns of ‘Payroll Pirates’ Hijacking HR SaaS Accounts to Steal Employee Salaries
item.description: A threat actor known as Storm-2657 has been observed hijacking employee accounts with the end goal of diverting salary payments to attacker-controlled accounts. "Storm-2657 is actively targeting a range of U.S.-based organizations, particularly employees in sectors like higher education, to gain access to third-party human resources (HR) software as a service (SaaS) platforms like Workday," the
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Comprehensive Guide to Conducting Effective Supplier Risk Assessments | UpGuard
item.description: Learn how to assess supplier risk, improve compliance, and reduce disruptions with a practical framework for vendor evaluation and ongoing risk monitoring.

item.title: Blackpoint Cyber vs. Arctic Wolf: Which MDR Solution is Right for You?
item.description: <p>Want to improve your security? Compare Blackpoint Cyber and Arctic Wolf to find the best MDR solution.</p> <p>The post <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com/article/blackpoint-cyber-vs-arctic-wolf-which-mdr-solution-is-right-for-you/">Blackpoint Cyber vs. Arctic Wolf: Which MDR Solution is Right for You?</a> appeared first on <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com">TechRepublic</a>.</p>
item.dc:creator: StudioA by TechnologyAdvice

item.title: From Detection to Patch: Fortra Reveals Full Timeline of CVE-2025-10035 Exploitation
item.description: Fortra on Thursday revealed the results of its investigation into CVE-2025-10035, a critical security flaw in GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer (MFT) that's assessed to have come under active exploitation since at least September 11, 2025. The company said it began its investigation on September 11 following a "potential vulnerability" reported by a customer, uncovering "potentially suspicious
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Attack Surface Reduction: Best Practices and Examples | UpGuard
item.description: Learn practical strategies and best practices to reduce your organization's attack surface, minimize vulnerabilities, and enhance cybersecurity.

item.title: Google Launches AI Bug Bounty with $30,000 Top Reward
item.description: Google has introduced a new AI Vulnerability Reward Program offering up to $30,000 for bug discoveries in its AI products

item.title: Autonomous AI Hacking and the Future of Cybersecurity
item.description: <p>AI agents are now hacking computers. They&#8217;re getting better at all phases of cyberattacks, faster than most of us expected. They can chain together different aspects of a cyber operation, and hack autonomously, at computer speeds and scale. This is going to change everything.</p> <p>Over the summer, hackers proved the concept, industry institutionalized it, and criminals operationalized it. In June, AI company XBOW took the <a href="https://www.techrepublic.com/article/news-ai-xbow-tops-hackerone-us-leaderboad">top spot</a> on HackerOne&#8217;s US leaderboard after submitting over 1,000 new vulnerabilities in just a few months. In August, the seven teams competing in DARPA&#8217;s AI Cyber Challenge ...</p>
item.dc:creator: Bruce Schneier

item.title: The AI SOC Stack of 2026: What Sets Top-Tier Platforms Apart?
item.description: The SOC of 2026 will no longer be a human-only battlefield. As organizations scale and threats evolve in sophistication and velocity, a new generation of AI-powered agents is reshaping how Security Operations Centers (SOCs) detect, respond, and adapt. But not all AI SOC platforms are created equal. From prompt-dependent copilots to autonomous, multi-agent systems, the current market offers
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: 175 Malicious npm Packages with 26,000 Downloads Used in Credential Phishing Campaign
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have flagged a new set of 175 malicious packages on the npm registry that have been used to facilitate credential harvesting attacks as part of an unusual campaign. The packages have been collectively downloaded 26,000 times, acting as an infrastructure for a widespread phishing campaign codenamed Beamglea targeting more than 135 industrial, technology, and energy
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: What Is Shadow IT? Risks, Benefits, and How to Manage It | UpGuard
item.description: Learn what shadow IT is, why it’s risky, and how to detect, assess, and manage it with automated discovery, risk scoring, policy controls, and playbooks.

item.title: Google: Clop Accessed “Significant Amount” of Data in Oracle EBS Exploit
item.description: GTIG highlighted indicators that Clop is behind the extortion campaign targeting Oracle EBS instances, with its activity likely beginning as early as August 9

item.title: From LFI to RCE: Active Exploitation Detected in Gladinet and TrioFox Vulnerability
item.description: Cybersecurity company Huntress said it has observed active in-the-wild exploitation of an unpatched security flaw impacting Gladinet CentreStack and TrioFox products. The zero-day vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-11371 (CVSS score: 6.1), is an unauthenticated local file inclusion bug that allows unintended disclosure of system files. It impacts all versions of the software prior to and
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.description: Discover leading cybersecurity risk assessment tools that help organizations identify vulnerabilities, manage threats, and enhance their security posture.​

item.title: Pro-Russia Hacktivists “Claim” Attack on Water Utility Honeypot
item.description: Forescout said that the TwoNet actor was lured into attacking a honeypot disguised as a water treatment utility, providing insights into the group’s tactics

item.title: CL0P-Linked Hackers Breach Dozens of Organizations Through Oracle Software Flaw
item.description: Dozens of organizations may have been impacted following the zero-day exploitation of a security flaw in Oracle's E-Business Suite (EBS) software since August 9, 2025, Google Threat Intelligence Group (GTIG) and Mandiant said in a new report released Thursday. "We're still assessing the scope of this incident, but we believe it affected dozens of organizations," John Hultquist, chief analyst of
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Top Tools to Mitigate Supply Chain Risks | UpGuard
item.description: Learn about the top supply chain risk management tools designed to help businesses identify, assess, and mitigate risks within their supply chains.​

item.title: GitHub Copilot 'CamoLeak' AI Attack Exfiltrates Data
item.description: While GitHub has advanced protections for its built-in AI agent, a researcher came up with a creative proof-of-concept (PoC) attack for exfiltrating code and secrets via Copilot.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: SonicWall: 100% of Firewall Backups Were Breached
item.description: SonicWall said a breach it disclosed last month affected firewall configuration files for all customers who have used SonicWall’s cloud backup service — up from its previous 5% estimate.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Culafi

item.title: From HealthKick to GOVERSHELL: The Evolution of UTA0388's Espionage Malware
item.description: A China-aligned threat actor codenamed UTA0388 has been attributed to a series of spear-phishing campaigns targeting North America, Asia, and Europe that are designed to deliver a Go-based implant known as GOVERSHELL. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.description: Marshall Erwin shares how crisis leadership shaped his path from CIA analyst to the US Congress to protecting global Web traffic at Fastly.

item.title: New ClayRat Spyware Targets Android Users via Fake WhatsApp and TikTok Apps
item.description: A rapidly evolving Android spyware campaign called ClayRat has targeted users in Russia using a mix of Telegram channels and lookalike phishing websites by impersonating popular apps like WhatsApp, Google Photos, TikTok, and YouTube as lures to install them. "Once active, the spyware can exfiltrate SMS messages, call logs, notifications, and device information; taking photos with the front
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Take Note: Cyber-Risks With AI Notetakers
item.description: Transcription applications are joining your online meetings. Here's how to create policies for ensuring compliance and security of your information.

item.title: Hackers Access SonicWall Cloud Firewall Backups, Spark Urgent Security Checks
item.description: SonicWall on Wednesday disclosed that an unauthorized party accessed firewall configuration backup files for all customers who have used the cloud backup service. "The files contain encrypted credentials and configuration data; while encryption remains in place, possession of these files could increase the risk of targeted attacks," the company said. It also noted that it's working to notify all
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Researchers Warn of Security Gaps in AI Browsers
item.description: A new report from SquareX Labs highlights security weaknesses in AI browsers like Comet, revealing new cyber-risks

item.title: ClayRat Spyware Campaign Targets Android Users in Russia
item.description: A new ClayRat spyware campaign has been observed targeting Russian users via fake apps on Telegram and exfiltrating data

item.title: ThreatsDay Bulletin: MS Teams Hack, MFA Hijacking, $2B Crypto Heist, Apple Siri Probe & More
item.description: Cyber threats are evolving faster than ever. Attackers now combine social engineering, AI-driven manipulation, and cloud exploitation to breach targets once considered secure. From communication platforms to connected devices, every system that enhances convenience also expands the attack surface. This edition of ThreatsDay Bulletin explores these converging risks and the safeguards that help
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: SaaS Breaches Start with Tokens - What Security Teams Must Watch
item.description: Token theft is a leading cause of SaaS breaches. Discover why OAuth and API tokens are often overlooked and how security teams can strengthen token hygiene to prevent attacks. Most companies in 2025 rely on a whole range of software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications to run their operations. However, the security of these applications depends on small pieces of data called tokens. Tokens, like
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.description: Russian hackers' adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) in cyber attacks against Ukraine has reached a new level in the first half of 2025 (H1 2025), the country's State Service for Special Communications and Information Protection (SSSCIP) said. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.description: A new report from TeamViewer found that 40% of global endpoints still run Windows 10, just days before security updates and support ends for the operating system

item.description: Threat actors are actively exploiting a critical security flaw impacting the Service Finder WordPress theme that makes it possible to gain unauthorized access to any account, including administrators, and take control of susceptible sites. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.description: The campaign is the latest by BatShadow, one of a growing number of cybercrime groups operating out of Vietnam.

item.description: Patch now: A bug (CVE-2025-53967) in a third-party option for connecting Figma to agentic AI can lead to remote code execution (RCE).

item.title: Hackers Exploit WordPress Sites to Power Next-Gen ClickFix Phishing Attacks
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers are calling attention to a nefarious campaign targeting WordPress sites to make malicious JavaScript injections that are designed to redirect users to sketchy sites. "Site visitors get injected content that was drive-by malware like fake Cloudflare verification," Sucuri researcher Puja Srivastava said in an analysis published last week. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Chinese Hackers Weaponize Open-Source Nezha Tool in New Attack Wave
item.description: Threat actors with suspected ties to China have turned a legitimate open-source monitoring tool called Nezha into an attack weapon, using it to deliver a known malware called Gh0st RAT to targets. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.description: Every year, weak passwords lead to millions in losses — and many of those breaches could have been stopped. Attackers don’t need advanced tools; they just need one careless login. item.description: Three prominent ransomware groups DragonForce, LockBit, and Qilin have announced a new strategic ransomware alliance, once underscoring continued shifts in the cyber threat landscape. The coalition is seen as an attempt on the part of the financially motivated threat actors to conduct more effective ransomware attacks, ReliaQuest said in a report shared with The Hacker News. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.description: According to TransUnion, digital fraud has cost companies $534bn in losses globally with US business hit hardest

item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a now-patched vulnerability in the popular figma-developer-mcp Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that could allow attackers to achieve code execution. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Cyber-Attack Contributes to Huge Sales Drop at JLR
item.description: Jaguar Land Rover has reported a 25% drop in volume sales in the three months up to September 30, largely due to the impact of the ongoing cyber incident

item.title: No Time to Waste: Embedding AI to Cut Noise and Reduce Risk
item.description: Artificial intelligence is reshaping cybersecurity on both sides of the battlefield. Cybercriminals are using AI-powered tools to accelerate and automate attacks at a scale defenders have never faced before. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.description: Learn how subdomain takeovers happen, how to prevent them, and what steps to take if your subdomain is compromised. Includes real-world examples and tools.

item.title: OpenAI Disrupts Russian, North Korean, and Chinese Hackers Misusing ChatGPT for Cyberattacks
item.description: OpenAI on Tuesday said it disrupted three activity clusters for misusing its ChatGPT artificial intelligence (AI) tool to facilitate malware development. This includes a Russian‑language threat actor, who is said to have used the chatbot to help develop and refine a remote access trojan (RAT), a credential stealer with an aim to evade detection. The operator also used several ChatGPT accounts to
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Cyberattack Leads to Beer Shortage as Asahi Recovers
item.description: A ransomware last week left the Asahi brewery in Japan struggling to take orders and deliver its products domestically, as manufacturers become a favored target.

item.description: Protect your organization from data leaks with UpGuard’s best practices and tools. Learn how to prevent sensitive information from being exposed or stolen.

item.title: ShinyHunters Wage Broad Corporate Extortion Spree
item.description: A cybercriminal group that used voice phishing attacks to siphon more than a billion records from Salesforce customers earlier this year has launched a website that threatens to publish data stolen from dozens of Fortune 500 firms if they refuse to pay a ransom. The group also claimed responsibility for a recent breach involving Discord user data, and for stealing terabytes of sensitive files from thousands of customers of the enterprise software maker Red Hat.
item.dc:creator: BrianKrebs

item.title: Attackers Season Spam With a Touch of 'Salt'
item.description: Researchers report an increase in the use of hidden content in spam and malicious email to confuse filters and other security mechanisms.

item.description: In a recent poll, readers shared how they're using vibe coding in AppDev (if they are at all). While some found success, others found the risks too great.

item.title: BatShadow Group Uses New Go-Based 'Vampire Bot' Malware to Hunt Job Seekers
item.description: A Vietnamese threat actor named BatShadow has been attributed to a new campaign that leverages social engineering tactics to deceive job seekers and digital marketing professionals to deliver a previously undocumented malware called Vampire Bot. "The attackers pose as recruiters, distributing malicious files disguised as job descriptions and corporate documents," Aryaka Threat Research Labs
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.description: Researchers say exploitation of CVE-2025-10035 requires a private key, and it's unclear how Storm-1175 threat actors pulled this off.

item.title: Google's New AI Doesn't Just Find Vulnerabilities — It Rewrites Code to Patch Them
item.description: Google's DeepMind division on Monday announced an artificial intelligence (AI)-powered agent called CodeMender that automatically detects, patches, and rewrites vulnerable code to prevent future exploits. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: New Research: AI Is Already the #1 Data Exfiltration Channel in the Enterprise
item.description: For years, security leaders have treated artificial intelligence as an “emerging” technology, something to keep an eye on but not yet mission-critical. A new Enterprise AI and SaaS Data Security Report by AI &amp; Browser Security company LayerX proves just how outdated that mindset has become. Far from a future concern, AI is already the single largest uncontrolled channel for corporate data
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: XWorm 6.0 Returns with 35+ Plugins and Enhanced Data Theft Capabilities
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have charted the evolution of XWorm malware, turning it into a versatile tool for supporting a wide range of malicious actions on compromised hosts. "XWorm's modular design is built around a core client and an array of specialized components known as plugins," Trellix researchers Niranjan Hegde and Sijo Jacob said in an analysis published last week. item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: 13-Year-Old Redis Flaw Exposed: CVSS 10.0 Vulnerability Lets Attackers Run Code Remotely
item.description: Redis has disclosed details of a maximum-severity security flaw in its in-memory database software that could result in remote code execution under certain circumstances. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-49844 (aka RediShell), has been assigned a CVSS score of 10.0. "An authenticated user may use a specially crafted Lua script to manipulate the garbage collector, trigger a use-after-free,
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Microsoft Links Storm-1175 to GoAnywhere Exploit Deploying Medusa Ransomware
item.description: Microsoft on Monday attributed a threat actor it tracks as Storm-1175 to the exploitation of a critical security flaw in Fortra GoAnywhere software to facilitate the deployment of Medusa ransomware. The vulnerability is CVE-2025-10035 (CVSS score: 10.0), a critical deserialization bug that could result in command injection without authentication. It was addressed in version 7.8.4, or the Sustain
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: What is Compliance Management in Cybersecurity? | UpGuard
item.description: Intelligent compliance management ensures you comply with relevant regulations while strengthening your resilience against cyberattacks.

item.title: Oracle EBS Under Fire as Cl0p Exploits CVE-2025-61882 in Real-World Attacks
item.description: CrowdStrike on Monday said it's attributing the exploitation of a recently disclosed security flaw in Oracle E-Business Suite with moderate confidence to a threat actor it tracks as Graceful Spider (aka Cl0p), and that the first known exploitation occurred on August 9, 2025. The malicious activity involves the exploitation of CVE-2025-61882 (CVSS score: 9.8), a critical vulnerability that
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Salesforce Extortion Accelerates With New Leak Site | UpGuard
item.description: The hacker collective Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters has launched a new leak site threatening to release data stolen from Salesforce instances.

item.title: Vendor Risk Assessments: An Ultimate Guide | UpGuard
item.description: Master vendor risk assessment: frameworks, real examples, and tools. Learn how automation and continuous monitoring strengthen your security.

item.title: Cyberattackers Exploit Zimbra Zero-Day Via ICS
item.description: A threat actor purporting to be from the Libyan Navy's Office of Protocol targeted Brazil's military earlier this year using the rare tactic.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Clop Ransomware Hits Oracle Customers Via Zero-Day Flaw
item.description: The infamous Clop gang has targeted a wide range of Oracle E-Business Suite customers using a newly disclosed zero-day vulnerability.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Culafi

item.title: Chinese Gov't Fronts Trick the West to Obtain Cyber Tech
item.description: Outwardly neutral Chinese institutions have been collaborating with Western orgs and researchers for the benefit of PRC state intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: New Report Links Research Firms BIETA and CIII to China’s MSS Cyber Operations
item.description: A Chinese company named the Beijing Institute of Electronics Technology and Application (BIETA) has been assessed to be likely led by the Ministry of State Security (MSS). The assessment comes from evidence that at least four BIETA personnel have clear or possible links to MSS officers and their relationship with the University of International Relations, which is known to share links with the
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: Oracle 0-Day, BitLocker Bypass, VMScape, WhatsApp Worm & More
item.description: The cyber world never hits pause, and staying alert matters more than ever. Every week brings new tricks, smarter attacks, and fresh lessons from the field. This recap cuts through the noise to share what really matters—key trends, warning signs, and stories shaping today’s security landscape. Whether you’re defending systems or just keeping up, these highlights help you spot what’s coming
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: 5 Critical Questions For Adopting an AI Security Solution
item.description: In the era of rapidly advancing artificial intelligence (AI) and cloud technologies, organizations are increasingly implementing security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure regulatory compliance. Among these measures, AI-SPM (AI Security Posture Management) solutions have gained traction to secure AI pipelines, sensitive data assets, and the overall AI ecosystem. These solutions help
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Oracle Rushes Patch for CVE-2025-61882 After Cl0p Exploited It in Data Theft Attacks
item.description: Oracle has released an emergency update to address a critical security flaw in its E-Business Suite software that it said has been exploited in the recent wave of Cl0p data theft attacks. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-61882 (CVSS score: 9.8), concerns an unspecified bug that could allow an unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise and take control of the Oracle
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

item.title: Chinese Cybercrime Group Runs Global SEO Fraud Ring Using Compromised IIS Servers
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have shed light on a Chinese-speaking cybercrime group codenamed UAT-8099 that has been attributed to search engine optimization (SEO) fraud and theft of high-value credentials, configuration files, and certificate data.&nbsp; The attacks are designed to target Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) servers, with most of the infections reported in India, Thailand
item.dc:creator: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
